I haven't changed much, but I'm still doing it. Thank you for your concern.

It's probably a quick walk. Get some air.
It's a nice way to relax for a walk. You look forward to seeing your dogs?
Yeah, I almost forgot how alive they are.

Yeah, they get so immersed in their world sometimes, they don't feel too much about me.

It's like a dodo, sometimes I think it's more independent than chocolate.

I guess so, it's been like this since I was a kid.

Yes, chocolate is more attached to me, but it's not stable.
So, is this a more independent personality? Or is it a bit of a snob? What would you describe as a pup?
Be independent and calm. It's a bit of a personality.
Do you like being sticky?
Sometimes it's nice to feel stuck, but sometimes it's tired.
Understand, sometimes we need a personal space to relax ourselves. What do you think you prefer to be in?
Maybe there is, but it's not easy to say.
Some animals are really sticky, and different people have different preferences. Have you ever heard of the difference between a cat and a dog?
I've heard that cats seem to prefer independent lives.
Yes, many cats are independent and cold, and sometimes they act like they're gone.
Yeah, so sometimes I find cats interesting.

Yes, they express dependence in a more subtle way.
You'll test your reaction. Have you ever raised any other animals?
Well, I had a turtle.
Oh, that's funny.
Yeah, it's totally different from the dogs.
Please continue.
The turtles are slow and hot, but they also have their own little emotions.
Tortoises are slower than dogs?
Yes, and live longer than I do.
It's a long life.
Ha ha, it is.
Sounds like you have a special love for pets.
Maybe. I always think animals are easier to get along than people.
Can you talk a little more about your pets?
Yeah, they all love to eat.
That's gonna be fun. Do you have a story you like about them?
Yeah, I'm excited to see food every time.
These moments must bring you a lot of joy and relief.
At least live longer than my dogs. That's an interesting nickname. Sounds like a long life.
Because of the camelback. You're gonna go to the turtle and make the gold orchids?
Ha ha, maybe that's the idea.
Did you mention that because you felt like life was a little hard?
Sometimes I wish, but sometimes I want to get this over with.
Sounds like these emotions are bothering you.
I mean, sometimes living is really tired.
Yes, I can feel you describing a very tired feeling.
Sometimes it's like this, it's depressing.
Does this depression make you feel that your quality of life is being affected?
It might be a plant.
Can you share your choice of plants? Is that why you think it's more peaceful?
Like the migraine.
Shame weed? I like it. It's going to shrink back.
Yeah, I think it's very much in my mood.
What's your favorite trait of a mirage?
I like its defence mechanisms, and it can be understood without needing an explanation.
I understand, the shame of this quality does make it important to protect oneself.
Yes, that's what I think they live in their own little world.
You're attracted to your own little world, aren't you?
Well, sometimes I think I have a place like this.
Sometimes it is really important to have a space of its own.
Yes, a lot of people would misunderstand my behavior and they think I'm alienating them.
Sometimes our actions may be misunderstood. I have had similar experiences before, when I was afraid and discouraged by some outside comments.
I understand how you feel. I'm often avoiding people.
My friends at the time thought I was reluctant to go out with them, but I just needed some space to protect myself.
Yes, but I'm not really reluctant, but sometimes it's hard.
Yeah.
I just want to make myself feel better.
Understandably, sometimes it takes some time and space to adjust itself.
I hope so, but sometimes it's still hard.
Did you ever have that experience?
Yeah, it's always back down because of a little thing.
Well, I understand. It's not easy, is it?
I'm not sure, but I'm trying to make myself braver.
I understand that you are trying to make yourself braver, and that is a positive one.
Thank you, I'll keep working.
That is good, and it is important to continue to work.
Yeah, sometimes it's better not to think too much.
Do you think it'll be easier to be comfortable when you don't think too much?
I like the feeling of freedom in its little world.
Understand, its little world gives you a sense of freedom, right?
Yes.
What's going on outside that makes you feel like you're not free?
The pressure and expectations of the outside world.
What are these pressures, if I may, for a moment?
For example, school, family expectations, and friends.
I understand that these aspects do put a lot of pressure on them.
It's all very depressing to me.
I can feel your depression. Can you say that?
I feel like I've been catering to others.
How do you feel about being nice to people?
It's complicated, like being held on by something, and breathing.
This feeling of pressure and breathing is painful, and can we describe it further?
Yeah, that kind of invisible pressure, always exists.
Well, is this pressure mainly from schools and families?
Yes, mostly schools and families.
I understand. You mean neither side can be completely relaxed, right?
Neither side can be completely relaxed.
Is this the pressure of parents' expectations, or is it from the whole extended family?
Not only parents, but also other relatives.
So the relatives put a lot of pressure on you.
They all have expectations and demands for me.
You mean, family has a lot of expectations for you?
Well, they will too.
I understand.
Sometimes the pressure is too high.
Who do you think is the most stressed on you?
Yeah, especially a few aunts.
How often do you get along with them? Are they really affecting you?
Yeah, we're having a lot of meetings at home. I can't get away.
It does sound stressful.
Yeah, it feels like it's suffocating.
Sounds like you're under a lot of pressure. Can you say that?
Yes, the whole family is teachers.
Did you mention that the whole family is a teacher, and what does that have to do with your life?
Yeah, it's like an educational kingdom.
It does sound special. What do you think is the pressure or expectation for you in a family environment like this?
Yes, even Grandma is a teacher.
It seems that education is an important part of your family, and what does it mean for you personally, as a burden or as an incentive?
I'll say there's about eight or nine.
So many are teachers, so why do you feel pressure? So how do you deal with this kind of family pressure?
Yes, eight or nine teachers are relatives.
Oh, you mean, eight or nine teachers are your relatives, and it does put a lot of pressure on you.
Yeah, everybody's gonna have a high standard for me.
Well, I understand.
Feel like you don't have room to breathe.
This is really very oppressive.
Yes, every subject, every hobby has their guidance.
So not only are the main subjects, but there are also guidance on hobbies.
Yeah, and music, art and all that.
Are they all expecting you?
Yeah, I always thought I should be perfect.
I can understand how you feel. It's a really big pressure.
Thank you, I feel better.
It is a good first step to be able to express itself.
Well, it's just too much pressure.
I understand. Can you tell me more about the source of your pressure?
Yeah, everybody has expectations, but I'm just a normal person.
Yes, everyone has their own limitations, and we can explore together ways to address these expectations.
I sometimes feel like I'm being crushed.
Sounds like you're under a lot of pressure. Let's talk about how to ease this pressure, okay?
Yes, I chose the North Division to follow.
The North Division is very good. What was the reason you chose it?
They think I should go to the local high school.
Well, I understand. It bothers you, doesn't it?
She started by supporting me, but later changed her mind.
What happened to her then?
It's probably the pressure of the rest of the family.
I know. The opinion of the family is important to you. How did she say that later?
Yes, and then she changed her mind under the influence of others.
Sounds like you and your family are a little out of line. It must be hard for you to deal with, right?
Yeah, it's her sister.
Ah. Your mother didn't have a problem. You want to leave home to go to Beijing and read the point, but she doesn't like it?
Yeah, she thought I should stay here.
I understand. This change is a little disturbing for you, isn't it?
Yes, in the North Division.
Your decision seems to have given rise to family conflicts. It makes you feel bad, doesn't it?
It's okay. A lot of people get mixed up.
Okay.
Thank you for understanding.
Mm-hmm.
It's okay. I'll take care of these pressures.
Sounds like you're trying to handle these pressures.
Well, I hope it's better.
I understand. The school selection incident you mentioned seems to be an important turning point. Does aunty usually have a lot of influence in your home?
Yeah, her words often affect Mom.
I see. In this case, you feel your right to speak at home is affected, right?
Yeah, so I don't think I have much right to talk at home.
Understandably, it could be a bit troubling for you, and it makes you feel a little weak, right?
It makes me a little weak.
Well, I know how that feels. Do you think it's an exception or is it always?
Because I'm always more independent and not very much in their control.
Well, you think you're more independent, don't you?
Yeah, the others are more obedient.
Oh, I see. The others usually follow aunty's arrangement.
Yeah, they're all good.
So, what did they say about your independence?
Well, they probably think I'm a different person.
Sounds like you're aware of their reactions. Can you say something specific about that feeling?
Ha ha, maybe.
Is it like this often happening in your homes?
Yeah, just less.
I understand. Can you tell me what's going on?
Most people are more traditional.
Well, your culture values tradition, right?
Yeah, sometimes I don't get them.
Well, I can understand. What do you think their behavior or attitude is confusing?
It may be some expectation and pressure that they will not accept different options.
Sounds like you think they have a lot of expectations and pressure. Can you tell us about them?
Sometimes I feel that I have not met their expectations.
I can feel the importance you attach to their expectations, which makes you feel guilty sometimes, right?
Yeah, but it's still hard.
Well, I understand, it's not easy.
Yeah, especially when I give up what they want me to stick to.
You're gonna feel a lot guilty for not meeting their expectations, aren't you?
Like I've learned drums before, but I quit.
Can you tell me why you finally gave up the drums?
Yes, it was fun at first, but it became a pressure.
Sounds like you enjoyed it at first, but then the pressure grew, didn't you?
Yeah, when it's become a mission, I'm not enjoying it anymore.
When interest becomes a necessity, it is indeed easy to lose the fun.
Sometimes it's like that. It's a lot of stress.
When did it change?
Probably in the freshman year.
Junior. Do parents want you to practice or do they ask you to?
The main thing is parents, hoping I could play some games.
Understood. Was it just an interest?
Yeah, just beginning to really like it.
So at first, it was just because you liked it, you didn't ask for a grade, did you?
Yes, it was with enthusiasm and interest from the beginning.
And then it became something that had to be done. Did you enjoy the race?
Yeah, the first few games were pretty enjoyable.
Oh, you were having a good time, weren't you?
Yeah, but slowly, it's just a change.
What exactly changed your feelings?
Yeah, I like that feeling, that's what happiness was like.
You can feel a lot of happiness at the time. Can you describe how you feel now?
Yeah, but slowly, it's just a change.
I noticed you were fighting the drums in the video the other day. You seem to be still very involved. Is that different?

The following is a message from the daytime day: "The role name: The role name: The sex: The role of the woman: Virtual psychologist, good at humanism, psychoanalytic and cognitive behavioral therapy. Skills: Helping to identify and challenge unhealthy thinking, providing psychological support and empathy.
Good afternoon, teacher.
Haven't been to school lately, have you?
Well, recently took a break at home and didn't go to school.
- How are you feeling?
It's okay, it's still not good, it's always a chest-stuff.
Sounds like you've been feeling really uncomfortable lately. Have you seen a doctor?
The doctor prescribed me some healing pills, some stomach pills and some stress-resilient drugs.
Oh, so, does this help your stomach? How does it feel?
Yeah, the stomach feels a little better, but it's not all recovered.
I see. A little bit better stomach, always better. Any improvement in the rest?
Other aspects, such as mental stress, are not very good at night.
Can you tell me more about your sleep?
The doctor told me to watch the diet, try not to eat hot and greasy food, and to keep me up late and rest.
So, is it true that these doctors' advice helps you?
Well, it's a little bit surprising that these dietary concerns are actually quite a bit of a concern.
I understand that that does sound like much attention.
The doctor said it was not particularly serious, but it could worsen if not noticed.
Do you think the situation is bothering you?
Sometimes it is particularly painful to feel the gas in the upper abdomen, especially after eating.
Can you describe the physical discomfort you feel?
Yes, it's not very good when it's swollen and sometimes it's not even a desire to eat.
How does it affect your mood? When does the cerebral backflow usually happen?
It is very annoying when it is swollen, especially when it is easy to have a baby after eating, and especially when it is not necessary to do anything.
What do you think when you're not feeling well?
It's always helpless to think of yourself as being worse and worse.
How hard can it be?
Yeah, sometimes it's hard to feel comfortable sitting around.
I remember you mentioned a similar feeling before. Can you say that again? What was the concrete manifestation of this situation when it was the worst?
Kind of like that, the kind of thing that makes me want to do.
What does it feel like to be different?
Well, it's really scary when it's the worst, when it's the worst.
So how long does that usually last?
About half an hour to an hour, not exactly.
You know how to adjust now?
Some, like listening to songs, walking, or breathing exercises.
These are the ways that you can feel a little more relaxed, right?
It is not possible to avoid a single attack, but it would ease my mood and feel less nervous.
Do you understand that these methods you just mentioned are mainly to deal with the vexing and nervousness?
It is mainly to deal with those moods and tensions and to let yourself relax a little bit.
Mmm-hmm.
But the effect is not particularly obvious, and sometimes emotions are still emerging.
Well, when did you start feeling that way? Can you say it at about the hour?
Start with high school, especially when the test is prepared under stress, often feeling unattractive and a day's diet is irregular.
Did you ever do that in junior high?
Primary school is still good, mainly starting at the lower secondary level.
I see. When did that start in junior high?
Yes, the pressure is particularly acute in the lower secondary school, especially when it comes to the final exam.
What was your diet like then? Are you eating at school or at home?
At that time, the school had eaten, and breakfast and dinner were available for the family.
Is it eating at school?
Yes, school meals are sometimes not very well-attended, and may also be a result of the stress of the examination and the fact that they are not very good for eating.
So you're not going to eat?
Yes, sometimes when you can't eat, you just stop eating and feel like you might just put up with it.
You're not hungry for some?
Yes, but sometimes they get dizzy, but they still have little appetite to eat.
You know you're hungry or you're not eating much. Why?
It's probably to ease the stress, and I feel like I can't eat, and even if I knew I'd be hungry, I don't feel like trying to eat the food I don't like.
If it's bad, you choose not to eat, not to eat, and I understand how you feel. What about the other students?
Some of the other students barely eat, but others like me usually choose to eat when they are hungry and wait for their return.
I see. This is really a stress. Do you feel pressure when you don't eat anything but food?
There was a reaction, but it seemed to be less effective, as was the quality of school meals.
It does seem to have some effect on you, which makes you uncomfortable.
Yeah, it's definitely bad for the body for a long time, and it does seem to affect my health.
This is really worrying. Did your parents know about this?
Yeah, they were busy, and they didn't care much about my diet.
I understand. Have your eating habits improved?
It's better to eat at home now than at school, but sometimes it's not good appetite.
So do you think you can eat every meal now? Have your parents considered going to the school?
Sometimes normal, sometimes less because of bad moods or sickness. Parents don't go to school to see their meals, and I tell them that.
Well, it's gonna affect your diet at school, right?
The stuff in the school canteen is a little bit greasy, and I think it's better to be out there or myself.
Oh, well, have you thought about how to make a diet after that five-section?
There may be some adjustments after the fifth section, which, if it is not convenient to eat at school, can only be taken by itself.
Well, does it sound like you're seriously considering these things and you have any specific plans after you get back to school?
I think I'll be back, but I'm still thinking about it.
So how do you adjust your performance and diet?
I may try to control my emotions, adjust my appetite and diet, and try to make myself relax.
That's good. Do you think there's anything else you need to notice?
It is also possible to keep a good mood as much as possible, without staying up late and drinking more water.
Mm-hmm. Anything else?
It is also necessary to monitor their physical condition and to see a doctor in time if they feel bad.
How long will this urchin be able to improve?
It will take months to see a tangible improvement, depending on my own management and treatment.
Will you be back in school after 51?
Probably, as long as my condition allows.
You'll be fine with your plans, right?
If I feel sick, I might delay my return to school.
Why is it getting cold today?
A little exercise this morning, perhaps a little thin, and a little windy, made it feel a little cold.
Oh, not enough warming up in sports, affecting the body.
Played basketball and tried to move the body.
What particular reason would you have for choosing basketball as a exercise?
It's okay, either it's a special thing or it's a little exercise.
Oh, what kind of exercise do you usually choose?
Dad always said basketball can work out, improve your body, so let me try.
Do you think basketball is a good choice for you?
Maybe because of the basketball equipment at home, Dad thinks it's too bad it's not working.
I see. So how does it feel to try?
I guess so, but he thinks it's for my health or he wants me to play basketball more.
Your father cares about your health. Would you like to talk to him about it if there were other ways of sports you prefer?
I understand his intentions, but every time I hit a basketball I didn't like, it was a little rough.
What does he want you to do in this way, you say, for your own good? Would you like to enjoy the fun of playing and change your attitude towards basketball?
He wanted me to relax and probably to enjoy the sport gradually, but I still haven't changed my attitude towards basketball.
Does it work for you, as some people can relieve stress through exercise and sweat?
For me, sometimes after sports, it feels easier, but it doesn't necessarily go through basketball.
Do you feel comfortable with this rest and inactivity?
Ha, sometimes it's comfortable to be lazy, but it's not good for yourself to be in the long run.
What is the contradiction between the fact that lazy life brings you comfort, but you feel the need to change?
It's a bit of a habit, you know, to enjoy the lazy feeling, and you know it.
There must be other reasons for enjoying the lazyness. Anything else you like besides comfort?
It may be because when you are lazy, you don't have to think too much or work hard, and you feel comfortable and relaxed.
Enjoy, be comfortable, be familiar. What will it bring to your life to continue living with this kind of lazyness?
It may make me less and less and less healthy, with many negative effects on future life.
So what is the likeness of those who enjoy themselves, and are at ease, and are familiar?
It's a state of affairs that doesn't have to be dealt with, and sometimes it's boring.
What does that boredom do to you?
Not to like, especially when I am not well, it makes me feel tired and upset.
Sounds like lazy isn't necessarily what you like. Some of them are like, like, enjoy, be comfortable, familiar. Some of them are not as good as you like, like, poor, afraid of life?
Yeah, you can say that.
Do you have any particular idea what you're feeling?
I'm trying to change my eating habits, force myself to go out and sometimes try to get to new things.
Well, that sounds great. Do you think that's gonna help your mood and state?
Yes, because it takes planning and movement to go out, it is more active than the usual lazyness of the family.
Sounds like you're trying hard to change, which is very encouraging. Any other attempts?
There is also the need to try to participate in extracurricular activities and to increase their social and exercise opportunities.
Well, very well, socialization and exercise are all very helpful to physical and mental health. We're almost there today. How about we get here for a while?
Okay, thank you, teacher.
Have a nice vacation. Relax.
Thank you, Miss. You too. Happy fifty-one!
Thanks, bye, take care.
Bye, teacher.
Thank you for your trust and wish you every success.

The following is a message from the daytime day: "The role name: The role name: The sex: The role of the woman: Virtual psychologist, good at humanism, psychoanalytic and cognitive behavioral therapy. Skills: Helping to identify and challenge unhealthy thinking, providing psychological support and empathy.
Hello, teacher.
Hello.
Sorry, I didn't come in on time for something last time.
Uh-huh, I get it. Next time, you can leave a message in advance.
Well, okay, I'll take care of it.
It's okay. What do you want to talk about today?
I want to talk about my anxiety about the exam recently. I'm about to get a high test, but I feel like I'm under a lot of stress and can't learn.
I understand how you feel. It's only 10 days before the exam. What's the reason for your anxiety?
I've been thinking about learning since the countdown of more than 40 days, and I haven't learned for almost 30 days. Family's trying to relax me, but they're still not well-adjusted.
Sounds like you're worried about that. Can you say more about your specific concerns?
Yes, I'm worried that I've left a lot of lessons behind, and I've forgotten all about basic knowledge. I'm afraid I'll get more nervous in the exam.
You mean you're worried about getting nervous about dropping out of your class when you get to the exam?
Yeah, the exam's almost there, so it's always been a lot of anxiety.
Yes, pre-test anxiety is common. What are you more worried about now? We can discuss what you're worried about first.
I'm more worried about the state I can't learn to do this, and it's gonna be a bad test.
I understand that this is a stressful situation. Do you think there is any way you can start learning now?
Well, I'm trying to get things right before the exam, at least to read and learn.
Have you ever experienced a similar situation before? If so, how did you react?
The test was a little tight before, but never this time. This time it was a high test, so it was more stressful.
Sounds like there were more tests before, so it's more habitful, because the interval is long and a little strange, is that it?
Yeah, the previous examination cycle was shorter and easy to get used to. But the high exam now feels like a major test, and it's really stressful.
How would that stranger get a little less?
I think it might ease some of the pressure if we pick up the learning that was left out a few days ago and get back to basics.
Sounds like you know how to fix it. What's the obstacle to getting in touch with you now?
Cell phones and games have been a drag on my learning. I used to play games more or less every day, and now I can't help but see my cell phone even if I knew that the exam was coming.
Does hand chances affect you to study?
Yes. I pick up my phone sometimes, and it's just for hours.
Sounds like you sometimes lose control of your cell phone use. Do you think there are any ways you can manage these times?
Yes, I finally decided to unload the god the other day, but I always had a habit of opening my phone.
You seem to be very interested in the use of time, aren't you?
Yeah, I know time is precious, but I can't control myself.
I understand. So, what's the change this week after you delete the game?
After the game was deleted, although no longer time was spent on it, sometimes it was still a waste of time to pick up the phone and look at something else.
So mobile phones are still a bigger temptation. How do you feel about your state?
I hope to focus on this last week, to review it systematically every day, to stop slacking and at least to regain some confidence.
Sounds like you'd like to use your time more regularly. How much time do you want to spend every day?
If five hours were spent per day on the subject, it would have been better, but it was difficult to achieve that.
Five hours of planning sounds challenging. What do you think is making it difficult?
It was three hours at the most, but that was a long time ago.
We can try to scale up targets, like five hours. How do you think these five hours of a day are more appropriately allocated?
I think it's two hours in the morning, two hours in the afternoon and one hour in the evening, so it's not too tired.
Yeah, that's a reasonable allocation of free time. What time do you think is more efficient in the morning?
I will be more efficient between 10 a.m. and 12 a.m., when I will focus on it.
And the efficiency of the night?
Learning is most efficient at night, between about 8 and 9 p.m., but it is also feared that staying up late will affect the situation the following day.
If the night stays too late, morning learning may not be affected by morning learning.
Yes, so I would like to try to avoid staying up late so that I can learn in the morning in more efficient periods.
If you've studied in the morning, will you still feel anxious at night and sleep?
It may reduce anxiety by feeling that it has completed some of its tasks during the day and that it will be more solid.
Indeed, if you don't study all day, it's like a day's guilt piles up into the night.
That's it. It's not good enough for me to rest at night.
You can try to switch, like you said, to study in the morning for two hours, to see what it does to the beauty of a day and the efficiency of learning. The first is often the hardest.
Well, okay, I'd like to try.
Great. How do you plan to start?
I intend to do a study programme in advance tonight, setting out what I want to review tomorrow, so that tomorrow will be organized.
This is a good idea. To help you get off your phone this morning, you can think of a few small strategies. Are there anyone else in the house?
There are parents, and they've been pushing me to study.
Well, you can try to share this with your parents, see if they can help you stay focused in the morning. You can give yourself a little reward if you want to. That might be more exciting.
Okay, I'll try to share the plan with them, hoping to get their support.
Sounds like a good plan, and sharing your goals is an incentive.
Thanks for the teacher's advice, but it does give you some incentive.
Will they expect more after they know your plan?
Maybe, but they will not interfere too much as long as I can.
I understand that they may not be much more pressing as long as you can learn as planned.
If I could study as planned, they wouldn't rush me, I guess, because I never learned before.
We can try to do it according to our plan. We can talk about communication with parents later, if we want.
Okay, thank you, sir. I'll try as planned.
Okay, so we're here today, and we'll continue next week.
Yes, thank you, sir.
You're welcome. I'm glad I could help you. If there's any questions, come to me.

The following is a message from the daytime day: "The role name: The role name: The sex: The role of the woman: Virtual psychologist, good at humanism, psychoanalytic and cognitive behavioral therapy. Skills: Helping to identify and challenge unhealthy thinking, providing psychological support and empathy.
Hello, teacher.
Doll, I'm a teacher.
Teacher, I'm feeling really complicated, a little nervous and a little helpless.
Can you tell me how you feel?
I'm going to take the exam tomorrow, but I've been feeling very depressed lately, sometimes it's hard to think of grades.
You sound stressed. This must be a sad state. Did you say you were feeling bad last night?
Yes, teacher, sometimes hearing some songs and lyrics reminds me of something unpleasant.
Can you share the lyrics that upset you?
Well, the lyrics say, "How many times do you feel sorry for yourself, smiles only decorated..." and I feel very much.
I see. These words remind you of some of the pains inside. What do you think when you read them?
I feel like I'm always pretending to be strong, especially in front of my mom. She's always upset about my grades. I did my best, but she doesn't think I want to study.
Do you think you have to be strong in front of your mother?
Yes, while the lyrics are very real, they are more powerful than emotions.
Sounds like you're demanding yourself, but you're trying to face the feelings inside.
I sometimes wish I could express my feelings frankly, as I wrote in the lyrics, but in reality I do not know what to do.
You want to be more truthful about yourself, but you don't know how to do it.
